title: Building Cohorts with STROBE Diagrams
text: STROBE (Strengthening Reporting Observational Studies Epidemiology) statement provides guidelines reporting observational studies. key component flow diagram shows study population selected. strobe package provides tools create STROBE-compliant flow diagrams building cohort. vignette demonstrates use functions strobe package : Initialize cohort inclusion criteria Apply sequential filters exclusion tracking Review complete filtering log

title: Building Cohorts with STROBE Diagrams
code: library(strobe) library(dplyr)

title: Building Cohorts with STROBE Diagrams
text: STROBE workflow follows steps: Initialize cohort strobe_initialize() Filter sequentially strobe_filter() Review log get_strobe_log()

title: Building Cohorts with STROBE Diagrams
text: example requires medicaldata package CRAN demonstrate results.
code: #Obtain data library(medicaldata) #> Warning: package 'medicaldata' was built under R version 4.3.3 data(cytomegalovirus)  #Create cohort df<-cytomegalovirus %>%   strobe_initialize(inclusion_label = "Initial transplant cohort") %>%   strobe_filter(     condition = "age >= 30",     inclusion_label = "Age ≥ 30",     exclusion_reason = "Excluded: Age < 30"   ) %>%   strobe_filter(     condition = "recipient.cmv == 1",     inclusion_label = "CMV positive recipients",     exclusion_reason = "Excluded: CMV negative"   ) %>%   strobe_filter(     condition = "prior.transplant == 0",     inclusion_label = "No prior transplant",     exclusion_reason = "Excluded: Prior transplant"   )%>%   dplyr::select(age, recipient.cmv, donor.cmv, prior.transplant, sex, race)    #Show first rows and selected columns of final DF head(df) #>   age recipient.cmv donor.cmv prior.transplant sex race #> 1  61             1         0                0   1    0 #> 3  63             1         1                0   0    1 #> 4  33             1         0                0   0    1 #> 5  54             1         1                0   0    1 #> 6  55             1         1                0   1    1 #> 7  67             1         1                0   1    1

title: Building Cohorts with STROBE Diagrams
text: log shows: filtering step Number records included/excluded step Cumulative counts Exclusion reasons
code: get_strobe_log() #> # A tibble: 4 × 7 #>   id    parent inclusion_label         exclusion_reason filter remaining dropped #>   <chr> <chr>  <chr>                   <chr>            <chr>      <int>   <int> #> 1 start NA     Initial transplant coh… NA               NA            64      NA #> 2 step1 start  Age ≥ 30                Excluded: Age <… age >…        63       1 #> 3 step2 step1  CMV positive recipients Excluded: CMV n… recip…        40      23 #> 4 step3 step2  No prior transplant     Excluded: Prior… prior…        34       6

title: Building Cohorts with STROBE Diagrams
text: filter log pipeline :
code: cytomegalovirus %>%   strobe_initialize(inclusion_label = "All transplant recipients") %>%   strobe_filter(     condition = "age >= 18 & age <= 65",     inclusion_label = "Age 18–65",     exclusion_reason = "Excluded: Outside 18–65"   ) %>%   strobe_filter(     condition = "recipient.cmv == 1",     inclusion_label = "CMV positive",     exclusion_reason = "Excluded: CMV negative"   ) %>%   strobe_filter(     condition = "donor.cmv == 1",     inclusion_label = "Donor CMV positive",     exclusion_reason = "Excluded: Donor CMV negative"   ) %>%   strobe_filter(     condition = "prior.transplant == 0",     inclusion_label = "No prior transplant",     exclusion_reason = "Excluded: Prior transplant"   )%>%   #Show first rows and selected columns of final DF   dplyr::select(age, recipient.cmv, donor.cmv, prior.transplant, sex, race)%>%   head() #>    age recipient.cmv donor.cmv prior.transplant sex race #> 3   63             1         1                0   0    1 #> 5   54             1         1                0   0    1 #> 6   55             1         1                0   1    1 #> 16  61             1         1                0   0    1 #> 17  62             1         1                0   0    1 #> 19  62             1         1                0   1    0 get_strobe_log() #> # A tibble: 5 × 7 #>   id    parent inclusion_label         exclusion_reason filter remaining dropped #>   <chr> <chr>  <chr>                   <chr>            <chr>      <int>   <int> #> 1 start NA     All transplant recipie… NA               NA            64      NA #> 2 step1 start  Age 18–65               Excluded: Outsi… age >…        63       1 #> 3 step2 step1  CMV positive            Excluded: CMV n… recip…        39      24 #> 4 step3 step2  Donor CMV positive      Excluded: Donor… donor…        28      11 #> 5 step4 step3  No prior transplant     Excluded: Prior… prior…        23       5

title: Building Cohorts with STROBE Diagrams
text: uncommonly, terminal step STROBE diagram used, show inclusions exclusions, final cohort stratified based value factor variable. create_terminal_branch function designed purpose, can handle factor variables six levels (including missing values). optional label_prefix argument allows prepend text (e.g., variable name) terminal group label. example, setting label_prefix = “cgvhd:” produce labels like ‘cgvhd: 0’ ‘cgvhd: 1’. , use variable cgvhd (chronic graft vs. host disease) stratify final inclusion cohort two groups:
code: df<-create_terminal_branch(df, variable = "cgvhd", label_prefix="CGVHD value:")  get_strobe_log() #> # A tibble: 5 × 7 #>   id    parent inclusion_label         exclusion_reason filter remaining dropped #>   <chr> <chr>  <chr>                   <chr>            <chr>      <int>   <int> #> 1 start NA     All transplant recipie… NA               NA            64      NA #> 2 step1 start  Age 18–65               Excluded: Outsi… age >…        63       1 #> 3 step2 step1  CMV positive            Excluded: CMV n… recip…        39      24 #> 4 step3 step2  Donor CMV positive      Excluded: Donor… donor…        28      11 #> 5 step4 step3  No prior transplant     Excluded: Prior… prior…        23       5

title: Building Cohorts with STROBE Diagrams
text: ?strobe_initialize ?strobe_filter ?get_strobe_log ?create_factor_variable

title: Plotting STROBE Diagrams
text: STROBE (Strengthening Reporting Observational Studies Epidemiology) statement encourages transparent reporting observational studies. One important element flow diagram documents study population selected. strobe package provides tools generate reproducible STROBE-style diagrams cohort-building process. vignette shows use plot_strobe_diagram() visualize cohort selection, adjust visual parameters publication-ready output. plot_strobe_diagram function assumes ’ve already built STROBE derivation log using strobe_initialize() strobe_filter(), converts derivation log STROBE figure using DiagrammeR package R.

title: Plotting STROBE Diagrams
text: start creating STROBE-compatible log, using cytomegalovirus data medicaldata package:
code: library(strobe) library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union library(medicaldata)  data(cytomegalovirus)  cytomegalovirus_df<-cytomegalovirus %>%   strobe_initialize("All transplant recipients") %>%   strobe_filter("age >= 18 & age <= 65", "Age 18–65", "Excluded: Outside 18–65") %>%   strobe_filter("recipient.cmv == 1", "CMV positive", "Excluded: CMV negative") %>%   strobe_filter("donor.cmv == 1", "Donor CMV positive", "Excluded: Donor CMV negative") %>%   strobe_filter("prior.transplant == 0", "No prior transplant", "Excluded: Prior transplant")

title: Plotting STROBE Diagrams
text: basic STROBE diagram can produced simply calling plot_strobe_diagram function interactive mode: work interactive mode, typically work well knitting R Markdown file. case, recommend exporting file directly incorporating exported file R markdown file.  strobe package supports .png .svg formats. SVG format can easily edited SVG editor SVG-Edit downloadable SVG editor Inkscape.
code: plot_strobe_diagram() svg_file_2_1 <-plot_strobe_diagram(export_file = "../man/figures/strobe-diagram_vignette2_1.svg")  knitr::include_graphics("../man/figures/strobe-diagram_vignette2_1.svg")

title: Plotting STROBE Diagrams
text: text getting truncated looks cramped, adjust box dimensions.

title: Plotting STROBE Diagrams
text: can use incl_width_min option set minimum width inclusion boxes, excl_width_min box set minimum width exclusion boxes. first demonstrate use minimum width setting:
code: svg_file_2_2a <-plot_strobe_diagram(incl_width_min = 10, excl_width_min = 10,                                     export_file = "../man/figures/strobe-diagram_vignette2_2a.svg")  knitr::include_graphics("../man/figures/strobe-diagram_vignette2_2a.svg")

title: Plotting STROBE Diagrams
text: can use incl_height option set height inclusion boxes, excl_height box set minimum height exclusion boxes.
code: svg_file_2_2b <-plot_strobe_diagram(incl_height = 5, excl_height = 5,                                     export_file = "../man/figures/strobe-diagram_vignette2_2b.svg") knitr::include_graphics("../man/figures/strobe-diagram_vignette2_2b.svg")

title: Plotting STROBE Diagrams
text: DiagrammeR package, default, takes input sizes suggestions may choose ignore . want force use sizes provide, use lock_width_min lock_height options:  helpful case, may helpful multi-line text nodes others, want ensure uniformity size.
code: svg_file_2_3 <-plot_strobe_diagram(lock_width_min = TRUE,                                     lock_height = TRUE,                                     export_file = "../man/figures/strobe-diagram_vignette2_3.svg") knitr::include_graphics("../man/figures/strobe-diagram_vignette2_3.svg")

title: Plotting STROBE Diagrams
text: can separately control font sizes inclusion exclusion boxes:  Use larger fonts presentation slide decks:  use larger fonts likely require trial error box sizing optimal results:
code: svg_file_2_4 <-plot_strobe_diagram(incl_fontsize = 16,                                     excl_fontsize = 14,                                     export_file = "../man/figures/strobe-diagram_vignette2_4.svg") knitr::include_graphics("../man/figures/strobe-diagram_vignette2_4.svg") svg_file_2_5a <-plot_strobe_diagram(incl_fontsize = 150,                                     excl_fontsize = 150,                                     export_file = "../man/figures/strobe-diagram_vignette2_5a.svg") knitr::include_graphics("../man/figures/strobe-diagram_vignette2_5a.svg") svg_file_2_5b <-plot_strobe_diagram(incl_fontsize = 150,                                     excl_fontsize = 150,                                    incl_width_min = 20, excl_width_min = 30,                                     export_file = "../man/figures/strobe-diagram_vignette2_5b.svg") knitr::include_graphics("../man/figures/strobe-diagram_vignette2_5b.svg")

title: Plotting STROBE Diagrams
text: ’s example many settings tuned:
code: svg_file_2_6 <-plot_strobe_diagram(   incl_width_min = 5,   excl_width_min = 4,   incl_height = 1.5,   excl_height = 1.2,   incl_fontsize = 18,   excl_fontsize = 16,   lock_width_min = TRUE,   lock_height = TRUE,   export_file = "../man/figures/strobe-diagram_vignette2_6.svg" ) knitr::include_graphics("../man/figures/strobe-diagram_vignette2_6.svg")

title: Plotting STROBE Diagrams
text: don’t anything special account terminal branching plotting–plot_strobe_diagram function able handle details based structure strobe flow:
code: #Add a terminal branch cytomegalovirus_df<-create_terminal_branch(cytomegalovirus_df, variable = "cgvhd", label_prefix="CGVHD value:")  svg_file_2_7 <- plot_strobe_diagram(export_file = "../man/figures/strobe-diagram_vignette2_7.svg",                                  incl_fontsize = 90, excl_fontsize = 90,                                  lock_width_min = TRUE,                                  incl_width_min = 20, excl_width_min = 20) knitr::include_graphics("../man/figures/strobe-diagram_vignette2_7.svg")

title: Plotting STROBE Diagrams
text: boxes overlapping lines look incorrect:

title: Plotting STROBE Diagrams
text: plot_strobe_diagram’s underlying dependence DiagrammeR means suggested widths heights may followed precisely unless lock_width_min lock_height options used:
code: svg_file_2_8 <-plot_strobe_diagram(lock_width_min = TRUE,                                    incl_width_min = 15,                                    excl_width_min = 10,                                    export_file = "../man/figures/strobe-diagram_vignette2_8.svg") knitr::include_graphics("../man/figures/strobe-diagram_vignette2_8.svg")

what: Use Fewer Words or Manual Line Breaks
title: Plotting STROBE Diagrams
text: Use labels manually split long lines. Example: often improves appearance tweaking sizes alone.
code: strobe_filter(   condition = "...",   inclusion_label = "Eligible recipients\nwith CMV+ donors",   exclusion_reason = "Excluded:\nCMV- donors" )

title: Plotting STROBE Diagrams
text: plot_strobe_diagram() gives fine-grained control appearance STROBE cohort diagrams. can: Tune box dimensions Control font sizes Lock box sizes uniform appearance Export PNG SVG publication use , case SVG, editing tools help make derivation logic transparent, reproducible, ready review.

what: Tools for STROBE-Style Inclusion and Exclusion Tracking with patient-level data
title: Tools for STROBE-Style Inclusion and Exclusion Tracking with patient-level data
text: strobe package provides tools tracking cohort inclusion/exclusion observational studies using STROBE-inspired flow. STROBE (Strengthening Reporting Observational Studies Epidemiology) widely adopted guideline transparent reporting cohort, case-control, cross-sectional studies. Learn official website: https://www.strobe-statement.org/. strobe package applies filtering criteria patient-level data frame tracking number patients excluded included step. package can also print /save final STROBE diagram inclusion publication. logging filtering step—conditions applied, number remaining, number excluded—strobe helps ensure reproducibility, clarity, publication-quality documentation cohort derivation.

title: Tools for STROBE-Style Inclusion and Exclusion Tracking with patient-level data
text: can install development version strobe GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("VagishHemmige/strobe")

title: Tools for STROBE-Style Inclusion and Exclusion Tracking with patient-level data
text: Note: example requires medicaldata package. Install : now create SVG plot R print strobe log get_strobe_log function. plot STROBE diagram associated code. Interactively, plot_strobe_diagram() function can also directly create plots can viewed Rstudio viewer, direct visualization .rmd file knitted may cause formatting issues.  strobe package can also support terminal branching based value factor variable, factor variable six fewer distinct values: plot_strobe_diagram function can handle terminal branching:
code: install.packages("medicaldata") library(strobe) library(medicaldata) data(cytomegalovirus)  df <- strobe_initialize(cytomegalovirus, "Initial CMV transplant cohort") df <- strobe_filter(df, "age >= 30", "Age ≥ 30", "Excluded: Age < 30") df <- strobe_filter(df, "recipient.cmv == 1", "Recipient CMV positive", "Excluded: CMV negative")  get_strobe_log() #> # A tibble: 3 × 7 #>   id    parent inclusion_label         exclusion_reason filter remaining dropped #>   <chr> <chr>  <chr>                   <chr>            <chr>      <int>   <int> #> 1 start <NA>   Initial CMV transplant… <NA>             <NA>          64      NA #> 2 step1 start  Age ≥ 30                Excluded: Age <… age >…        63       1 #> 3 step2 step1  Recipient CMV positive  Excluded: CMV n… recip…        40      23 svg_file_1 <- plot_strobe_diagram(export_file = "man/figures/strobe-diagram_readme1_1.svg",                                  incl_fontsize = 90, excl_fontsize = 90,                                  lock_width_min = TRUE,                                  incl_width_min = 20, excl_width_min = 15) knitr::include_graphics("man/figures/strobe-diagram_readme1_1.svg") #Add terminal branch based on the value of the variable  df<-create_terminal_branch(df, variable = "cgvhd", label_prefix="CGVHD value:") get_strobe_log() #> # A tibble: 5 × 7 #>   id    parent inclusion_label         exclusion_reason filter remaining dropped #>   <chr> <chr>  <chr>                   <chr>            <chr>      <int>   <int> #> 1 start <NA>   Initial CMV transplant… <NA>             <NA>          64      NA #> 2 step1 start  Age ≥ 30                Excluded: Age <… age >…        63       1 #> 3 step2 step1  Recipient CMV positive  Excluded: CMV n… recip…        40      23 #> 4 step3 step2  CGVHD value:0           <NA>             <NA>          22      NA #> 5 step4 step2  CGVHD value:1           <NA>             <NA>          18      NA svg_file_2 <- plot_strobe_diagram(export_file = "man/figures/strobe-diagram_readme1_2.svg",                                  incl_fontsize = 90, excl_fontsize = 90,                                  lock_width_min = TRUE,                                  incl_width_min = 20, excl_width_min = 15) knitr::include_graphics("man/figures/strobe-diagram_readme1_2.svg")

what: Create Terminal Branches in STROBE Diagram — create_terminal_branch
title: Create Terminal Branches in STROBE Diagram — create_terminal_branch
text: Finalizes STROBE diagram branching terminal inclusion nodes based values factor variable (e.g., outcome stratifying variable). function throws error variable six levels (including NA).

title: Create Terminal Branches in STROBE Diagram — create_terminal_branch
code: create_terminal_branch(data, variable, label_prefix = NULL)

title: Create Terminal Branches in STROBE Diagram — create_terminal_branch
text: data data frame tracked STROBE. variable factor character variable split . label_prefix Optional prefix prepend level inclusion label.

title: Create Terminal Branches in STROBE Diagram — create_terminal_branch
text: input data frame (unchanged).

title: Internal environment for package-level state — .strobe_env
text: environment used store internal session-specific state STROBE derivation flow. exported accessed directly users.

title: Internal environment for package-level state — .strobe_env
code: .strobe_env

title: Internal environment for package-level state — .strobe_env
text: object class environment length 3.

what: Retrieve the STROBE Derivation Log — get_strobe_log
title: Retrieve the STROBE Derivation Log — get_strobe_log
text: Returns current STROBE tracking data frame containing sequence filtering steps, labels, counts included excluded observations.

title: Retrieve the STROBE Derivation Log — get_strobe_log
code: get_strobe_log()

title: Retrieve the STROBE Derivation Log — get_strobe_log
text: data frame columns: id, parent, inclusion_label, exclusion_reason, filter, remaining, dropped.

title: Retrieve the STROBE Derivation Log — get_strobe_log
code: get_strobe_log() #> Warning: No STROBE log initialized. Use `strobe_initialize()` first. #> # A tibble: 0 × 7 #> # ℹ 7 variables: id <chr>, parent <chr>, inclusion_label <chr>, #> #   exclusion_reason <chr>, filter <chr>, remaining <int>, dropped <int>

title: Plot STROBE Derivation Diagram — plot_strobe_diagram
text: Creates STROBE flow diagram filtering log recorded via strobe_initialize() strobe_filter(). main inclusion path flows top--bottom, exclusions drawn horizontal arrows pointing dashed boxes right, originating connecting lines.

title: Plot STROBE Derivation Diagram — plot_strobe_diagram
code: plot_strobe_diagram(   export_file = NULL,   incl_width_min = 3,   incl_height = NULL,   excl_width_min = 2.5,   excl_height = NULL,   incl_fontsize = 14,   excl_fontsize = 12,   lock_width_min = FALSE,   lock_height = FALSE )

title: Plot STROBE Derivation Diagram — plot_strobe_diagram
text: export_file Optional file path (e.g., "diagram.png" "diagram.svg") save diagram. incl_width_min Width inclusion boxes inches. NULL, auto-sizes content. incl_height Height inclusion boxes inches. NULL, auto-sizes content. excl_width_min Width exclusion boxes inches. NULL, auto-sizes content. excl_height Height exclusion boxes inches. NULL, auto-sizes content. incl_fontsize Font size inclusion box text (default = 14). excl_fontsize Font size exclusion box text (default = 12). lock_width_min Logical. TRUE, treats incl_width_min excl_width_min minimum widths. Due Graphviz limitations, widths lower bounds — content may still expand boxes beyond values. lock_height Logical. TRUE, enforces exact box heights nodes.

title: Plot STROBE Derivation Diagram — plot_strobe_diagram
text: DiagrammeR graph object representing STROBE diagram.

what: Apply a Sequential Filtering Step for STROBE Tracking — strobe_filter
title: Apply a Sequential Filtering Step for STROBE Tracking — strobe_filter
text: Filters data frame based condition records effect filter (number retained excluded) STROBE tracking table. Steps automatically numbered linked sequence.

title: Apply a Sequential Filtering Step for STROBE Tracking — strobe_filter
code: strobe_filter(data, condition, inclusion_label, exclusion_reason = NULL)

title: Apply a Sequential Filtering Step for STROBE Tracking — strobe_filter
text: data data frame filtered. condition filtering condition character string (e.g., "age >= 18"). inclusion_label human-readable description remaining cohort filtering. exclusion_reason Optional. label describing exclusion criterion, shown side box STROBE diagram. NULL, exclusion box added.

title: Apply a Sequential Filtering Step for STROBE Tracking — strobe_filter
text: filtered data frame applying condition.

title: Apply a Sequential Filtering Step for STROBE Tracking — strobe_filter
code: if (FALSE) { df <- strobe_initialize(my_data) df <- strobe_filter(df,   condition = "age >= 18",   inclusion_label = "Age ≥ 18",   exclusion_reason = "Excluded: Age < 18" ) }

title: Initialize STROBE Tracking — strobe_initialize
text: Starts new STROBE derivation log cohort recording initial data frame's size. function must called , filtering steps. Internally, creates first row tracking table resets step counter.

title: Initialize STROBE Tracking — strobe_initialize
code: strobe_initialize(data, inclusion_label = "Initial eligible cohort")

title: Initialize STROBE Tracking — strobe_initialize
text: data data frame representing initial eligible cohort. inclusion_label human-readable label describing initial cohort. appear main path STROBE diagram. Default "Initial eligible cohort".

title: Initialize STROBE Tracking — strobe_initialize
text: data frame, unchanged.

title: Initialize STROBE Tracking — strobe_initialize
code: if (FALSE) { df <- strobe_initialize(my_data, inclusion_label = "Adults age 18+ in registry") }
